properties.media:imagetext:
BRACE POSITION
WHEN SO DIRECTED, ASSUME THIS POSITION BEFORE AND
DURING LANDING, WITH SEAT BELT FASTENED, PLACE BOTH
FEET TOGETHER ON THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF YOU, LEAN
FORWARD AND DOWN AS FAR AS POSSIBLE AND CLASP HANDS
Where time permits, flight attendant will pass out blankets and pillows for padding.
A word about Seats and Seat Belts
THE "FASTEN SEAT BELT" SIGN IS LOCATED DIRECTLY ABOVE THE CABIN ENTRANCE AT THE FORWARD END OF THE CABIN. ROUGH AIR
(TURBULENCE) AT HIGH ALTITUDES, ALTHOUGH INFREQUENT, CAN BE SEVERE, WHEN THE SEAT BELT SIGN IS ILLUMINATED IN-FLIGHT,
PLEASE COMPLY WITH THE SIGN TO PREVENT POSSIBLE INJURY, SEASONED AIR TRAVELERS USUALLY LEAVE THIER SEAT BELTS FASTENED
ALL THE TIME AND PULL THEM SNUG WHENEVER THE SEAT BELT SIGN IS LIGHTED,
Oxygen
FLOTATION CUSHION
OXYGEN IS AVAILABLE FOR MEDICAL PURPOSES, SHOULD THE NEED ARISE.
Floatation Seat Cushions
YOUR SEAT CUSHION IS A LIFE PRESERVER. IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCY DITCHING ON
WATER, GRASP THE BACK OF THE CUSHION AND PULL UPWARD TO REMOVE. TAKE IT WITH
YOU AND USC SIKAS AS SHUWN
Smoking
THE "No-SMOKING" SIGN IS LOCATED DIRECTLY ABOVE THE CABIN ENTRANCE AT THE FORWARD END OF THE CABIN. WHEN THE SIGN
IS OFF, YOU MAY SMOKE WHILE SEATED IN A SMOKING AREA OF THE CABIN. WHEN THE SIGN IS ILLUMINATED, HOWEVER, SMOKING
WILL NOT BE PERMITTED.
Pets in the Cabin
A PET BEING TRANSPORTED MUST REMAIN IN ITS KENNEL AND THE KENNEL MUST REMAIN IN THE CARRY-ON LUGGAGE RACK. THIS SERVICE
IS ON SPACE AVAILABLE BASIS ONLY,
FEDERAL REGULATIONS
Seat Backs and Seat Trays
EACH PASSENGER SEAT BACK AND SEAT TRAY MUST BE IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION PRIOR TO TAXIING, TAKE-OFF OR LANDING,
EACH PASSENGER MUST COMPLY WITH INSTRUCTIONS GIVEN BY CREW MEMBERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THIS REGULATION.
Alcoholic Beverages
NO PERSON SHALL DRINK ANY ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE ABOARD AN AIR CARRIER UNLESS SUCH BEVERAGE HAS BEEN SERVED TO
HIM/HER BY THE AIR CARRIER OPERATING THE AIRCRAFT,
NO AIR CARRIER SHALL SERVE ANY ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE TO ANY PERSON ABOARD AN AIR CARRIER AIRCRAFT IF SUCH PERSON
APPEARS TO BE INTOXICATED,
NO AIR CARRIER SHALL PERMIT ANY PERSON TO BOARD AN AIR CARRIER AIRCRAFT IF SUCH PERSON APPEARS TO BE INTOXICATED.
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES CANNOT BE SERVED TO MINORS,
ALL GLASSES AND CANS MUST BE REMOVED FROM CABIN BEFORE LANDING.
Carry-on Baggage
CARRY-ON BAGGAGE IS LIMITED TO AN AMOUNT THAT CAN BE PLACED BENEATH THE SEAT, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HANG-UP
BAGS WHICH MAY BE HUNG IN THE CLOSET, AND COATS AND HATS WHICH MAY BE PLACED IN THE OVERHEAD RACK.
ALL CARRY-ON RETAINED BY THE PASSENGER MUST BE PLACED BENEATH THE SEAT DURING TAKE-OFF AND LANDING.
No-Smoking Section
A SEAT MUST BE PROVIDED FOR EACH PERSON DESIRING A SEAT IN THE NO-SMOKING SECTION. IT IS FREQUENTLY NECESSARY
TO EXPAND THE NO-SMOKING SECTION TO ACCOMMODATE EVERYONE. IN THE EVENT OF A FULL FLIGHT IT IS, SOMETIMES,
NECESSARY TO SEAT SMOKERS IN THE REMAINING SEATS OF THE LAST NO-SMOKING ROW. SMOKING IS PROHIBITED IN ALL
ROWS PERMANENTLY OR TEMPORARILY DESIGNATED "No-SMOKING"
DO NOT TAKE THIS CARD FROM THE AIRCRAFT
2002.127.136

ASPEN AIRWAYS, INC.
CV-580
The airplane on which you are traveling is one
of the safest aircraft in service today.
Your
safety is always our first concern, and our pilots
and hostesses are thoroughly trained to cope
with any emergency which might arise. Should it be necessary to evacuate the
aircraft, there are a number of exits available for your use. These are described below.
FRONT
WINDOW
EXITS
REAR
ENTRANCE?
Shall not be used as
an exit unless directed by a crew member
DOOR
EXIT
WITH
SLIDE
WINDOW EXITS
Grasp handle inside
Slot over window.
Pull in and down.
Lift window. Turn on
side and throw out.
Face rear of cabin.
If over wing, step out
sit down on rear of wing
and slide to ground.
If not over wing, pull
escape rope from top ol
, climb out
window fear firs, clim
or slide to ground
REAR DOOR EXIT
Turn handle to the
rear and up.
Push door out to open.
Pull red handle to
inflate slide.
Move away from ircraft quickly
(OV R)
Remove high heel
shoes-
jump onto
slide with feet up
